text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
be making a very popular Street snack in
Vietnam that is loved by many students
and teenagers that is the green papaya
salad with shredded beef jerky in
Vietnamese is called loiter local bar
you have to try this to know why it is
so popular in Vietnam and let's begin
the main ingredient is of course a green
papaya we're gonna peel completely and
then shred it into thin strips using a
mandolin or shredder then soak it into a
bowl of cold water depending where you
live green papaya can be very expensive
this small one here cost me more than
four euros you can also buy the frozen
shred papaya which is a lot cheaper
similar to the rice paper salad recipe
I'm also using beef liver cut into cubes
then we're going to marinate with a
teaspoon of minced garlic
a tablespoon of minced cellist or you
can use the white part of spring onion 3
tablespoon soy sauce add a spoonful by
powder a tablespoon sugar half a
teaspoon pepper and half a teaspoon
chicken stock mix really well and let
marinate for at least two hours or
overnight in the fridge after that in a
pan or wok add in about 1 tablespoon of
vegetable oil and quickly stir fry the
marinated beef flavor you can see that
there's a lot of tools coming up the
liver after marinating just stir-fry
quickly for about 2 to 3 minutes until
the liver gets firmer and it's no longer
pink then remove and transfer the liver
cubes into a baking tray lined with
aluminum foil then insert the tray into
a preheated oven 850 degrees Celsius for
about 45 minutes after every 10 minutes
you just take out and rotate the cube so
that they get right out faster
then finally this is what I get
they turn black but not because they are
burnt that is the normal color of dry
beef liver just tie them into smaller
pieces with all the seasonings and
marinades is super tasty already this is
the leftover sauce we are going to make
a salad dressing from this add half a
cup water and two to three tablespoons
soy sauce to your taste simmer on low
heat for about one to two minutes to
assemble the dish we out the excess
water from the green papaya and place it
on a plate you might want to add in a
little bit more a threaded carrots for
more beautiful color then a handful of
chopped real mint top up with the dried
beef liver and shredded beef jerkey some
more our fresh rotters peanuts and we
are done so beautiful and colorful isn't
it yourself simply drizzle some of the
sauce that we made some chili sauce
together with a little bit of lime juice
or vinegar mmm so irresistible I hope
you like this recipe and don't forget to
click light and sky to my channel to
receive emails every time I upload a new
video and finally I get over my laziness
to set up a Twitter and Instagram
account you can follow me there if
you're curious about what I eat and cook
every day and maybe have a sneak preview
of what's gonna come up next on my
channel thank you for watching bye bye
you're all free
as Lee hyung
